repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Sidney Harwood Collection of Textile Industry Graphics
did.physdesc: Photomechanical prints, relief halftones (prints), relief photomechanical processes .
did.abstract: Engineering drawings and blueprints for textile machinery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engineering drawings from James Hunter Machine Company for wool washers (text in Spanish). Engineering drawings from Davis & Furber Machine Company for finisher cards, breaker cards, burr machines, and pickers. Also includes blueprints for carding machines and oilers designed by Fred Spivey.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sidney Harwood Collection of Textile Industry Graphics #6890 G. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: American Textile History Museum Collection, gift of Sidney Harwood.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The ATHM # references the accession number given to collections by the American Textile History Museum. These numbers have been kept and tracked for researchers looking for former citations. For images, these numbers will also be the digital object identifier if the item was scanned.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6890 P: Sidney Harwood Collection of Textile Industry Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tanque de 48 plgs. por 24 pies [1.22 por 7.30 m]. James Hunter Machine Co., North Adams, Mass., E.U.A. [Wool washer?]. Halftone. The James Hunter Machine Co. did business in numerous South American countries and Cuba; this print was clearly meant for the Spanish-speaking market. Image of machinery; company logo in upper left-hand corner.

did.unittitle: Lavadora de Lana Modelo D con Rastrillos Independientes [Model D Wool Washer with Independent Rake], ATHM# 0000.237.2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tanque de 48 plgs. por 16 pies [feet] [1.22 por 4.88 m.]. James Hunter Machine Co., North Adams, Mass., E.U.A. Halftone. The James Hunter Machine Co. did business in numerous South American countries and Cuba; this print was clearly meant for the Spanish-speaking market. Image shows wool washer; company logo is in the upper left-hand corner of the print.

did.unittitle: Finisher Card, 60 Inch Diameter, with Double Apron Rubb and Winding Frame, ATHM# 0000.237.3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print of finisher wool card [with Apperly-type feed]. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 21).

did.unittitle: Breaker Card, 48 Inch Diameter, with Single Burr Machine, ATHM# 0000.237.4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print. Photomechanical halftone print of [first] breaker wool card [with Bramwell feed]. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 20).

did.unittitle: 59 In. Diam. Breaker with No. 17 Garnet Breast, ATHM# 0000.237.5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print of breaker with garnet breast; eight 7 in. workers on card proper and three on the breast. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 16). Copy A.

did.unittitle: 60 In. Diam. Breaker with No. 17 Garnet Breast, ATHM# 0000.237.6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print of breaker with garnet breast; eight 7 in. workers on card proper and three on the breast. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 16). Copy B.

did.unittitle: 60 In. Diam. Breaker with No. 17 Garnet Breast, ATHM# 0000.237.7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print of breaker with garnet breast; eight 7 in. workers on card proper and three on the breast. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 16). Copy C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical print of three views of burr machines: single burr machine; single burr machine with lumper; and double burr machine. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 18).

did.unittitle: All Iron Construction Fearnaught Picker, ATHM# 0000.237.9

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print of Fearnaught picker. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1909 (see p. 9). Copy A.

did.unittitle: All Iron Construction Fearnaught Picker, ATHM# 0000.237.10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. Photomechanical halftone print. Photomechanical halftone print of Fearnaught picker. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1909 (see p. 9). Copy B.

did.unittitle: Cotton Waste Type Breaker Card, ATHM# 0000.237.11

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Davis & Furber Machine Company, North Andover, Mass. A. Mugford, Boston [engraver?]. Photomechanical halftone print of cotton waste type breaker card. Illustration from Davis & Furber trade catalogue of 1908 (see p. 34).

did.unittitle: End Elevation of Spivey's Patent Duplex Oiling Machine, ATHM# 0000.237.21

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fred Spivey, Low Mills, Heckmondwike, West Yorkshire, England. Bluepint. 1 1/2 " = 1 '

did.unittitle: Spivey's Patent Oiling Motion for Gill Box, ATHM# 0000.237.22

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fred Spivey, Low Mills, Heckmondwike, West Yorkshire, England. Bluepint.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fred Spivey, Low Mills, Heckmondwike, West Yorkshire, England. Bluepint. Print no.40. For oiling wool, shoddy, hair, rags, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fred Spivey, Low Mills, Heckmondwike, West Yorkshire, England. Bluepint. Broad band feed for Garnett card. Side elevation of carding machine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Built by Davis & Furber Machine Co., North Andover, Mass. With Improved Bramwell Feed Built by Geo. S. Harwood & Sons. Photolithograph. Image of carding machine. Probably built for the Wood Mill, Lawrence, Mass., according to the donor.
